results.title: La Mia Vita = My Life
results.brief_description: An elderly Italian man decides to look through his photo album. This causes him to reflect on his life. From his youth, to his adolescence, through to his older years, the man looks back on the moments of his life that he treasures the most, and those that are very dear to his heart.

results.title: Ignatius Quince: the cautionary tale of a Child Genius
results.brief_description: Every year the school held a science fair. Ignatius Quince, being the child genius he was, had won it for the last 5 years. This year was to be no exception. Ignatius Quince was going to build the most stupendous experiment. However plans don’t always run smoothly and Ignatius Quince gets a hand from a most unexpected person, Mable Syrup.

results.title: The Devoted Friend
results.brief_description: This open ended Oscar Wilde tale challenges us to consider whether a bully is aware that they are a bully. It questions whether you can expect a bully to reform by asking them to reflect on their actions. The story shifts focus from the question “what is a bully?” to “what is a true friend?”.

results.title: 100 Pages
results.brief_description: ‘100 Pages’ is a project based upon the theme of North Sydney Girls High School’s Centenary. This project used the School’s identity and history as inspiration for artmaking. Through the artmaking, students are celebrating the school’s identity in the present and past community; isolating individual events, subjects and objects as inspiration. The title of the unit, ‘100 Pages’, comes from the initial idea of 100 animations, for 100 years of history. This project has been developed for the Stage 5 elective, Year 10 Photography and Digital Media class (PDM), which comprises 12 students from North Sydney Girls High School.

results.title: The Long Now
results.brief_description: There is a giant clock ringing deep inside a mountain in the belly of the Sierra Diablo Ranges - The land of the Devil. It is a huge clock, hundreds of feet tall, designed to tick for 10,000 years. The mountain in which the clock resides is privately owned by Jeff Bezos. Programmed never to chime the same melody twice, its anyone’s guess how many beautiful songs will never be heard over the clock’s 10 millennial lifespan. Xanthe Dobbie’s new experimental desktop performance ponders the human urge to seek immortality. Featuring original epic hero Gilgamesh and the disembodied deep fake voice of Alan Rickman, The Long Now collapses histories, illuminating ancient and contemporary myth-making practices.
